title: 107_hr3178
content:
The Act is titled the "Water Infrastructure Security and Research Development Act" and includes definitions for key terms. SEC. 2. DEFINITIONS. The term "Administrator" refers to the head of the EPA. A "research organization" is an institution with expertise in water system security research. A "water supply system" includes public water systems and treatment works treating municipal waste or sewage. SEC. 3. WATER SUPPLY SYSTEM SECURITY RESEARCH ASSISTANCE. The Administrator, in consultation with other relevant agencies, will establish a research program to improve technologies for water supply system security. Grants will be provided to research organizations for vulnerability assessment and technology development. The research program aims to develop technologies for protecting water supply systems from threats, disseminate results to increase awareness, create security protocols, and implement real-time monitoring systems against attacks. The Administrator shall conduct research and develop technologies for mitigating biological, chemical, and radiological contamination of water supply systems. Guidelines, procedures, and criteria for awards will be published in consultation with relevant agencies and entities. The Administrator will ensure diversity in awards for various water supply projects and recipients, and include security measures for research and development activities under the award. The Administrator will require appropriate dissemination of research and development results for individuals receiving awards under this section. SEC. 4. EFFECT ON OTHER AUTHORITIES.

This Act does not limit the Administrator's authority under other laws to award grants or enter agreements for projects described in this Act.

SEC. 5. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS.

$12,000,000 is authorized for the Administrator for fiscal years 2002-2006. Funds shall remain available until expended. The curr_chunk is simply "Clerk."
